name: Ampharos
flavorText: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, you may search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Lightning Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Blissey
flavorText: Anyone who takes even one bite of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
Ability1Text: When you play Blissey from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 8 damage counters from Blissey. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from Blissey. Either way, if Blissey has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Celebi
flavorText: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.
Ability1Text: If an opponent's attack would Knock Out Celebi, flip a coin. If heads, Celebi isn't Knocked Out and you shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power doesn't work if Celebi is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Crobat
flavorText: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
Attack1Text: If your opponent attaches an Energy card to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn, that Pokémon becomes Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Delibird
flavorText: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. If exactly 1 is heads, this attack does 40 damage. If exactly 2 are heads, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. If all 3 are heads, this attack does 60 damage. If all 3 are tails, remove all damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

name: Entei
flavorText: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.
Ability1Text: When you play Entei from your hand, you may discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If you have fewer cards in your deck than that, discard all of them.) If any of those are Fire Energy cards, attach them to any of your Fire Pokémon of your choice. Using this power ends your turn.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy cards attached to Entei or this attack does nothing.

name: Ho-oh
flavorText: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent seven colored wings.
Attack1Text: You may search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Ho-Oh. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom or this attack does nothing. If there are any Darkness Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Houndoom.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Darkness Energy attached to Houndoom. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Jumpluff
flavorText: Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.
Attack1Text: Choose any number of your Hoppips and Skiplooms. Then, for each Pokémon you chose in this way, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and attach it to that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving those Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Three Magnemites are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your Magnemites, Magnetons, or Dark Magnetons and attach it to a different 1 of your Magnemites, Magnetons, and Dark Magnetons. This power can't be used if Magneton is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Magneton.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep and was attacked with Night Eyes during your last turn, it is Knocked Out.

name: Porygon2
flavorText: This upgraded version of Porygon is designed for space exploration. It can't fly, though.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and choose an Energy type. Treat that Energy card as that type until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Porygon2 becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, the Energy card goes back to its original type.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose whether the Defending Pokémon becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Raikou
flavorText: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. This power stops working while Raikou is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raikou does 20 damage to itself.

name: Suicune
flavorText: Said to be the reincarnation of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, other than damage, done to Suicune. This power stops working while Suicune is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If only 1 is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Aerodactyl
flavorText: A vicious Pokémon from the distant past, it appears to have flown by spreading its wings and gliding.
Ability1Text: Whenever an Evolved Pokémon attacks (even if it's your opponent's), it can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. It still has to pay for that attack's Energy cost. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Aerodactyl. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Celebi
flavorText: When Celebi disappears deep in a forest, it is said to leave behind an egg it brought from the future.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads. Remove a number of damage counters from Celebi equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Celebi has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Entei
flavorText: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.
Ability1Text: As long as Entei is your Active Pokémon, Entei and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this Power is active, discard any Trainer cards attached to Entei. (This power works even if Entei is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. For each tails, discard 1 Fire Energy card from Entei, if it has any.

name: Ho-oh
flavorText: A legend says that its body glows in seven colors. A rainbow is said to form behind it when it flies.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each type of Basic Energy card, if any, attached to Ho-Oh.

name: Kingdra
flavorText: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.
Attack1Text: Use any attack from Kingdra's Basic Pokémon card or Evolution card. (Kingdra doesn't have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and discard it. If both are tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Lugia
flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
Attack1Text: You may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Raichu
flavorText: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu. If you do, this attack does 80 damage.

name: Raikou
flavorText: A Pokémon that races across the land while barking a cry that sounds like crashing thunder.
Ability1Text: As long as Raikou is your Active Pokémon, Raikou and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this Power is active, discard any Trainer cards attached to Raikou. (This power works even if Raikou is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Skarmory
flavorText: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Skarmory.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard all Trainer cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Starmie
flavorText: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Choose an Energy type other than Colorless. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon with any Energy cards of that type attached to it. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
Ability1Text: As long as Sudowoodo is your Active Pokémon, it copies all of the Defending Pokémon's attacks, including their costs. This power can't be used if Sudowoodo is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Suicune
flavorText: This Pokémon races across the land. It is said that north winds will somehow blow whenever it appears.
Ability1Text: As long as Suicune is your Active Pokémon, Suicune and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this Power is active, discard any Trainer cards attached to Suicune. (This power works even if Suicune is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

name: Flaaffy
flavorText: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Golbat
flavorText: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.
Attack1Text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Either way, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Graveler
flavorText: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Don't apply Resistance.

name: Jynx
flavorText: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change Lanturn's type to Water until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Lanturn becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed after you have used this power, its type changes back to Lightning.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Magcargo
flavorText: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.
Ability1Text: If Magcargo is your Active Pokémon and moves to the Bench, remove 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo, if any, and attach it to the new Active Pokémon. (You can't choose an Energy card that you used to pay the Retreat Cost.)
Attack1Text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Magcargo when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

name: Octillery
flavorText: It traps enemies with its suction cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rockhard head.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, whenever the Defending Pokémon attacks, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (Benching or evolving that Pokémon ends this effect.)

name: Parasect
flavorText: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushrooms on its back.
Ability1Text: As long as Parasect is in play, cards in any player's discard piles are not affected by attacks or Pokémon Powers. This power stops working if Parasect becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Piloswine
flavorText: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from Piloswine. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.
Attack2Text: Piloswine does 30 damage to itself. Piloswine can't use this attack during your next turn.

name: Seaking
flavorText: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Stantler
flavorText: Those who stare at its antlers will gradually lose control of their senses and be unable to stand.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, choose 1 of its attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to 1 of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Unown [B]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name to Unown [B]. This power can't be used if Unown [B] has 10 HP left. This power can be used even if Unown [B] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Unown [Y]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can be used even if Unown [Y] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Aipom
flavorText: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
Attack1Text: Choose a Trainer card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Chinchou during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Chinchou is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

name: Farfetch'd
flavorText: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.
Attack2Text: This attack can't be used during your next turn. (Benching Farfetch'd ends this effect.)

name: Geodude
flavorText: It uses its arms to steadily climb steep mountain paths. It swings its fists around if angered.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in the water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card named Murkrow and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Murkrows on your Bench. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Paras
flavorText: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Quagsire
flavorText: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Qwilfish
flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads you get.

name: Remoraid
flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Shuckle
flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 40 or less damage to Shuckle (after applying Weakness and Resistance), reduce that damage to 10. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Shuckle is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Skiploom
flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Slugma
flavorText: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Smoochum
flavorText: It always rocks its head slowly backwards and forwards as if it is trying to kiss someone.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

name: Snubbull
flavorText: It has an active, playful nature. Many people like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Snubbull. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Staryu
flavorText: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Swinub
flavorText: If it smells something enticing, it dashes headlong off to find the source of the aroma.
Attack2Text: Swinub does 10 damage to itself.

name: Unown [K]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Your opponent's attacks, Pokémon Powers, and Trainer cards can't discard Energy cards from your Pokémon with Unown in their names. (Any other effects still happen.)

name: Zubat
flavorText: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Shining Gyarados
flavorText: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Shining Gyarados. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy cards attached to Shining Gyarados or this attack does nothing. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it and discard those Energy cards.

name: Shining Magikarp
flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.
Attack1Text: Your opponent may draw 2 cards. Either way, you may draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a card named Gyarados, Dark Gyarados, or Shining Gyarados. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
